summary: To summarize, you have expressed that you enjoy the way smoking calms you, but you also dislike the smell of cigarettes. You have expressed an interest in quitting smoking and have acknowledged that it will require willpower on your part. Additionally, you have stated that you want to make this change to improve your health and appearance. Is there anything else I should have included in this summary?

To summarize, it seems that you enjoy the physical act and feeling of smoking, and dislike the smell. At this point, you don't feel that you want to make any changes to your smoking habit, but understand that it will require discipline and persistence if you do want to make a change. Additionally, you have identified one step you could take to make this change by keeping yourself busy in other ways. Is there anything else I missed?

I understand that you want to reduce the negative effects of smoking and that you plan to do this by quitting smoking or smoking less, and using nicotine replacement therapy (NRT). You also mentioned that you want to stop smoking among your friends. Does this summation of our conversation capture everything you wanted to say?

You're not sure what to replace smoking with yet, but you believe that finding a substitute habit is the first step you need to take to make this change. Is there anything I missed in my reply?

I understand that you enjoy the flavor and relaxation of smoking, but are concerned about the health effects. Your goal is to reduce the number of cigarettes you smoke, believing this will improve your health and odor. You recognize that this requires discipline and you are willing to make the necessary changes. Is there anything else we should discuss before we end this conversation?

Is there anything else that you feel should be included in this summary before we end this conversation?

Is there anything I missed in my summary?
